solution_line_template: By the first two months, {erupted_percentage_first_phase}*{total_volcanoes} = <<{erupted_percentage_first_phase}*{total_volcanoes}={erupted_first_phase}>>{erupted_first_phase} mountains had erupted.

The total number of mountains remaining after the first round of explosions is {total_volcanoes}-{erupted_first_phase}= <<{total_volcanoes}-{erupted_first_phase}={remaining_after_first_phase}>>{remaining_after_first_phase}

When {erupted_percentage_second_phase} of the remaining mountains exploded, the number of mountains that were still intact decreased by {erupted_percentage_second_phase}*{remaining_after_first_phase} = <<{erupted_percentage_second_phase}*{remaining_after_first_phase}={erupted_second_phase}>>{erupted_second_phase}

The number of mountains that hadn't exploded after the second explosions is {remaining_after_first_phase}-{erupted_second_phase} = <<{remaining_after_first_phase}-{erupted_second_phase}={remaining_after_second_phase}>>{remaining_after_second_phase}

When {erupted_percentage_third_phase} of the mountains which were still intact exploded, the number of mountains that hadn't erupted was reduced by {erupted_percentage_third_phase}*{remaining_after_second_phase} = <<{erupted_percentage_third_phase}*{remaining_after_second_phase}={erupted_third_phase}>>{erupted_third_phase}

At the end of the year, {remaining_after_second_phase}-{erupted_third_phase} = <<{remaining_after_second_phase}-{erupted_third_phase}={mountains_intact_end_year}>>{mountains_intact_end_year} mountains remained intact and hadn't exploded.
